string_table.name: npxnabnsnfns00001111101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

terms.term: Volume of electrons in an electrical current, abbreviated as Amps or A
Closed loop along which electrons flow
Materials that allows electrons to flow easily, examples are copper, steel, and gold
Rate at which electrons flow along a conductive pathway, measured in Amps (A)
Concentration of energy, or power, at a contact point
Percentage of time electrical current is "flowing" vs. "not flowing"
Flow of energy released when electrons and neutons are in an unstable state
Number of times an alternating current (AC) reverses in one second, measured in Hertz (Hz)
Measurement of frequency or number of times a waveform repeats itself per second, abbreviated as Hz
Materials that inhibits the flow of electrons, examples are rubber, wood, and plastic
Product of voltage and current, measured in Watts (W)
Ease by which electrons flow through a current
Force needed to push electrons through tissue, measured in Volts (V)
Rate an electrical "load", such as a light bulb, pushes electrons to create an effect, abbreviated as W
Pattern of electrical energy over time
